intro: Andromeda fontanesiana, commonly known as the Fontanesia azalea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and other acid-loving plants. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in late winter to early spring. Its evergreen foliage consists of dark green, leathery leaves that provide a striking contrast to its floral display. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained, acidic soils.
